Horse Racing Tips - Flexibility is key during October
;
;No matter where you source your horse racing tips, a highly flexibly approach for long term profits is required. There are certain weeks of the year when your betting funds should be very carefully looked after. October is without a doubt one of those times!
;
;During the summer months successfully printing profits betting on horse racing is often straight forward. The breeding traits for flat racing are quite easy to read for the experienced horse racing fan. Like the start of the flat season in the spring, October can be a highly volatile time of year to be betting.
;
;I even know many shrewd punters will quite literally take a betting holiday during this month!
;
;So why is October such a tough time of year to be laying on ;http://www.2percentracing.com/horse-racing-tips.html; ?
;
;The racing codes are changing. Most of the quality flat animals have been put away for the season. Others that have not are coming back from injury or other problems that have kept them from the racecourse during the summer. Whilst others might be deemed as horses that will be suited to racing more the following season. The fact is, unless you really know the plans for your horse racing tips on the day you will start to struggle to pick consistent winners.
;
;The next issue with making your punting pay during this time of year is the unpredictability of those horses starting out in the jumps game! Again you almost need to be more connected to stables and information about your horse racing tips for this time of the year more than any other!
;
;You have only two real options:
;
;- Take the month off
;
;- Change how you bet
;
;If you are going to not bet during the month, then great decision made! The hardest thing will be now about when you make your decision to start again. Mid November would be a good time, the form book is starting to make sense again and the results become more predictable. Start 'trading' your horse racing tips on paper again and see how you get on before parting with hard earned cash!
;
;The obvious approach is to start spreading your bets. Dutch betting is a fantastic method used by some of the best pro punters on the planet! In essence you learn to back more than one horse in any race, and that is without question a golden rule. By learning which two or three risk can be minimised by backing higher percentage of the book.
;
;For those very good at this approach to betting individual winnings are reduced on every potential investment. However considering our points about this time of the betting year this shrewd approach can help to keep your betting bank in order!
;
;You will be able to find much information online about how this works. Dutch betting will be easier for some than others, perseverence however is advised as this method is golden! You can find Dutch betting calculators online to help with the stake calculation.
;
;Be sure to consider your approach to betting during the various times of the year. No one month is the same as the next, with tough times during October this flexibility will serve you well. When you learn to Dutch trade quickly, you can simply watch for the money a couple of minutes before a race and back those horses in your Dutch calculations. ;
;So what can be done to find more ;http://www.2percentracing.com/horse-racing-tips.html; that can win?
;
;There are a few things that can be done in order to improve your win strike rate, you just need before anything else to realise that the ice is thin, treading carefully is the solution. Apart however from taking this most drastic tactic, what should you be looking for and what can you do to find more winning horse racing tips?
;
;* Reduce stakes - Betting successfully is all about confidence. If you have experienced a semi-pro or even full time betting career you will know just how much your own confidence will have a say in the outcome of your betting. The more you begin to lose, the more your confidence will be knocked. Seasoned punters however know that losses are only short term therefore they do not panic when a string of losers arrive. If you can't stand to watch bets lose you must stake accordingly at this time of year. After a long and fruitful flat campaign, noboday wants to hand back hard earned winnings!
;
;Reducing stakes can help you keep your sanity and keep you confidence. When your horse racing tips a winning edge once more that might be the time to revert a more aggressive staking total.

;
;Look for trainers with a 24% of larger strike rate. Be sure to consider the sample size that the winning percentage is from. Tim Vaughn is worth keeping an eye out for. His horses tend to be highly race ready and if fancied in the trading should be considered a live contender.
;
;The key thing to remember is that nobody is infallable at this time of year. Be careful which ;http://www.2percentracing.com/horse-racing-tips.html; you back.
